Main power-up for all blocks. Setting to 1 an automatic power up sequence is starting, allowing power up of all necessary blocks (bandgap, ldos, curr.calibration, pll). For power-down, the opposite

When high disables control pattern flow through PDM1 channel (enabled by default)

Selects the number of bit for control patterns representation

PDM control silence pattern activation This bit stays high during pattern repetitions. It is automatically reset at repetition number expiring. Autoreset is disabled when continuos repetition is selected. In this case repetitions can be stopped by manual
PDM control pattern repetiton number
Selects the value of MSB bits of control pattern to repeatingly issue. This register is effective only when 16-bit control patterns are selected. Otherwise LSB only are issued
Selects the value of LSB bits of control pattern to repeatingly issue. When 8-bit control patterns are selected this register only is issued

TDM wire mode selection

[used only in master mode] Fsyn low duration in number of bclk (1024-1) . Note that it must be lower that the number of bclk inside one fsyn clock cycle. 10d0 = 1 bclk (default) 10d1 = 2 bclk ... 10d1023 = 1024 bclk
(used only in master mode) Set the bclk_freq = bclk_freq=(pll_clk_freq/(rfu_bclk_rate+1)) (default=0)

[used only in master mode] Fsyn low duration in number of bclk (1024-1) . Note that it must be lower that the number of bclk inside one fsyn clock cycle. 10d0 = 1 bclk (default) 10d1 = 2 bclk ... 10d1023 = 1024 bclk
(used only in master mode) Set the bclk_freq = bclk_freq=(pll_clk_freq/(rfu_bclk_rate+1)) (default=0)
If rfu_bclk_dith=1, set the dithering mode
[used only in master mode] Max number of slots that can be allocated on the bus (0-15). After the last slot, the bclk is stopped. Not used if set to 0

Enables ZC detection on output channel based volume ramp
Volume ramp step time selector (applied when ZC detection is disabled)

Selects the audio signal hysteretic double threshold to be used for ZC based volume ramp control. This selection applies to volume control units 3 and 4, that are corresponding to PDM 1 and PDM 2 channels

Selects the audio signal hysteretic double threshold to be used for ZC based volume ramp control. This selection applies to volume control units 1 and 2, that are corresponding to SDM 1 and SDM 2 channels
Selects the automute operating mode. This selection applies to volume control units 3 and 4, that are corresponding to PDM 1 and PDM 2 channels
Selects the automute operating mode. This selection applies to volume control units 1 and 2, that are corresponding to SDM 1 and SDM 2 channels

Selects the time filter duration for automute to be issued. Signal under threshold condition is deglitched with the selected timing before automute being issued. Automute is released immediately as soon as audio signal returns above threshold. This select applies to volume control units 3 and 4, that are corresponding to PDM 1 and PDM 2 channels

Selects the time filter duration for automute to be issued. Signal under threshold condition is deglitched with the selected timing before automute being issued. Automute is released immediately as soon as audio signal returns above threshold. This select applies to volume control units 1 and 2, that are corresponding to SDM 1 and SDM 2 channels

01 (default)
11 (default)
Ramp step duration

32768 Hz clock prescaling factor for spread spectrum triangular frequency modulation wave step advance. (default=010001) Time step = (ssc_div_set + 1) * (1 / 32768 Hz). Modulation frequency = 32768 Hz / (4 * ssc_spread_set * (ssc_div_set +1))

Spread spectrum triangular frequency modulation wave mean value selector. (Default=1110001) Mean frequency = (ssc_mean_set + 360) * 32768 Hz. ssc_mean_set is supposed to be treated as a signed 2s complement value
Spread spectrum triangular frequency modulation wave amplitude selection. (default=010010) Modulation amplitude peak-to-peak = (2 * ssc_spread_set) * 32768 Hz

PLL bypass (done in digital domain)
PLL lock mask

Enables the loop path redirecting SDM data streams on AUX1 and AUX2 inputs to allow following full digital path for audio signal: I2S + SRCI + VOL + OVS + SDM + DWA + INV DWA + DWS + SRCO + I2S The user must take care that the full path is enabled

Enables the loop path redirecting PDM stereo bitstream on DMIC12 data input to allow following full digital path for audio signal: TDM + SRCI + VOL + OVS + PDM + MIX + DEMIX + DWS + SRCO + TDM The user must take care that the full path is enabled
It forces adc 1 power up/down sequencer to advance to next state while not being in idle or in ready mode (autoresetting bit)
It forces adc 2 power up/down sequencer to advance to next state while not being in idle or in ready mode (autoresetting bit)
It forces ana (sdm) sequencer to advance to next state while not being in idle or in ready mode (autoresetting bit)
It forces device power up/down sequencer to advance to next state while not being in idle or in ready mode (autoresetting bit)

Direct DWA data access when DWA test modes (code 11) are selected. Selects 2s complement data value to be transferred to DAC (-32 to +32). Together with tst_idx[4:0] allows for DAC direct access for test and software implementation of randomizing algorit
Allows reconstruction filter DAC test access. Together with dwa1_mode and dwa2_mode enables different shapes for the selected DAC test

Direct DWA index access when DWA test modes (code 11) are selected. Selects the first available position in data randomizing process. Together with tst_data[6:0] allows for DAC direct access for test and software implementation of randomizing algorithms
Selects PDM sampling frequency when tst_expand_pdm_mode bit is set

Allows for more selections of pdm modes beside those selectable through PDM_mode_sel register. When high, tst_pdm_ord_sel and tst_pdm_fout_sel registers can be used for PDM modulator mode configuration
Selects PDM modulator order when tst_expand_pdm_mode bit is set

This field introduces a programalbe delay in 1ns increments on the PDM_SDA data line before it is sampled internally by the selected PDM_CLK edge
This field selects the sampling edge of the PDM_CLK used by the 88PM822 to sample the PDM_SDA stream.
